p: In this study, we tested about 30 plant EOs ( Supplementary Table S2) and their major compounds to evaluate their antifungal activity against two typical pathogens of grains ( A. flavus and A. ochraceus) by fumigation. In solid media, only seven vaporous EOCs exhibited an inhibitory effect against the above molds ( Supplementary Table S1), and two EOCs (citral and geraniol) with better properties were appropriate for subsequent studies. The impact of these two EOCs on fungal growth was increased progressively with concentration. Interestingly, A. ochraceus with treatment of geraniol at the concentration of 0.3 to 0.6 Î¼L/mL was not completely inhibited, owing to the saturation of geraniol in the vapor phase.
